speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Hey, and welcome to our town hall with Joe Biden.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Mr. Vice President, welcome to you.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Good to be with you.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: We’re here with a group of Pennsylvania voters.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: You can see they’re all appropriately socially distanced tonight.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: And there are a group of, some are voting for you, some have said they’re voting for president Trump, some are still undecided, and we’re going to try to take questions from as many of them as we can tonight.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Okay.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: And we’re going to start with Nicholas Fed, and he’s from Jenkintown, Pennsylvania.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: That’s close to here, in Philadelphia.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I know it well.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: You’re a Democrat.

speaker: Audience Member 1
text: I’m a Democrat.

speaker: Audience Member 1
text: Thank you, George.

speaker: Audience Member 1
text: Mr. Vice President, every day, my wife and I are in disbelief at the lack of coordinated federal action on COVID-19.

speaker: Audience Member 1
text: We know that your administration would follow the science.

speaker: Audience Member 1
text: My question for you, it’s two parts.

speaker: Audience Member 1
text: First, looking backwards to when this country first became aware of COVID-19, what would following the science have meant in terms of actual policy?

speaker: Audience Member 1
text: And then, looking forward, what would your administration do in terms of following the science with real concrete policies that haven’t been done by the current administration?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Well, first of all, going back, the fact is that the president was informed how dangerous this virus was.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And all the way back in the beginning of February, I argued that we should be keeping people in China.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And we had set up, in our administration, a pandemic office within the White House.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: There were 44 people on the ground.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I suggested that we should be seeking, and I didn’t hold public office, I was a former Vice President, we in fact asked to have access to the source of the problem.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And the best of our knowledge, Trump never pushed that.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: All those 44 people came home, never got replaced.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: In addition to that, I pointed out that I thought in February, I did a piece for USA Today saying, “This is a serious problem.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Trump denied it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: He said it wasn’t.”

speaker: Joe Biden
text: We later learned that he knew full well how serious it was when he did an interview with George Woodward.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I mean, excuse me, Bob Woodward.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And at the time, he said he didn’t tell anybody because he was afraid Americans would panic.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Americans don’t panic, he panicked.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: He didn’t say a word to anybody.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Then I wrote a piece in March about what I thought we should be doing to take hold of this, using the… There’s an act that passed a long time ago that allows the president to go into a business and say, “Stop making this, and start making that.” And it took a long time for him to even institute that, to get ventilators and so on.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And so, the point was he missed enormous opportunities and kept saying things that weren’t true.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: It’s going to go away by Easter, don’t worry about it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: When the summer comes, it’s all going to go away like a miracle.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: He’s still saying those things.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Before you go to the future, can I follow up on the, “I’m looking backwards.” just a little bit?

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: You did have an op-ed in January where you warned of the seriousness of the pandemic, but there’s no record of you calling for social distancing, limited social gatherings, mandatory mask-

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Not back then.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: In January, February.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Not in January, February.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: No, that’s correct, there wasn’t.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: That came at the end of March.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And then I laid out a detailed plan relative to school openings in June and July.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: By that time, the science was becoming clearer and clearer of how this was spreading so rapidly.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: But the president kept denying that.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: If you notice, from March on, I stopped doing big meetings, I started wearing masks.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: So, it was at a time when the science was saying, and his key people, Dr. Fauci were saying, “You should be taking these precautions.” So, what we should be doing now, there should be a national standard.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Instead of leaving this up to, remember what the president said to the governors, “Well, they’re on their own, it’s not my responsibility.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: The governors can do what they need to do, not my responsibility.” It is a presidential responsibility to lead, and he didn’t do that.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: He didn’t talk about what needed to be done because he kept worrying, in my view, about the stock market.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: He worried if he talked about how bad this could be, unless we took these precautionary actions, then in fact, the market would go down.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And his barometer of success to the economy is the market.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Thirdly, what we didn’t do is, the president had an opportunity to open and allow schools and businesses to stay open if they got the kind of help they needed.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: So, the Congress passed a couple of trillion dollars worth of help.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And what happened was most of that money, a significant portion of that money went to the very wealthiest corporations in the country, didn’t get to the mom and pop stores.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: So, you had one in five, one in six minority businesses closing.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Many of them permanently.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: People being laid off.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And then what happened was, when the first round of money for unemployment, enhanced unemployment went by, he didn’t do anything.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: He didn’t do anything.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And to the best of my knowledge, and I mean this sincerely, I can’t think of, I’ve been around for a lot of presidents, and you know a lot of presidents in a crisis, I don’t ever remember one never calling the House and Senate Republicans, Democrats together.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Let’s look forward a little bit.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: You said that you would lock down the economy, only if the scientists said it was necessary.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: By the way, in the context, would I lock down the economy if science said so?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I said I’d follow science.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: But I don’t think there’s a need to lock down.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Yeah, but I want to press you on that point.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: You’ve been in the Oval Office for eight years with President Obama, he would always say that only the hard to solve problems-

speaker: Joe Biden
text: [crosstalk 00:06:15] Get there.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: What is most likely to happen is, the scientists will disagree.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: The scientists will disagree with the economist.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: So the question is, how are you going to decide this?

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Who are you going to listen to?

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: And how can you can contain the pandemic without crushing the economy?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Well, you can contain the pandemic by being rational and not crush economy.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: For example, I laid out a plan, how you can open businesses.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: You can open businesses and schools, if in fact you provide them the guidance that they need, as well as the money to be able to do it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: What’s happening now is, we know, for example, if you can open a business and you could have a sign on the door saying, “Safe to come in.” And that’s why people aren’t going anyway, when they’re open.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And say, because you have social distancing, you have plastic barriers, when you go to the cashier, you have separators between the booths.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: You don’t have large crowds, you reduce the size, the number of people you can have in the restaurant.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: You make sure there’s testing, that’s a really critical piece that he didn’t do testing and tracing.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And you make sure that people are equipped, going to schools.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: You know, we initially said, the government initially said, they’re going to provide masks for every student and every teacher.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Then they said, “No, no, no, no.” FEMA said, the president or whomever said, ‘No, no, no.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: That’s not a national emergency, not a national emergency.”

speaker: Joe Biden
text: We need more teachers in our schools to be able to open smaller pods.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: We need ventilation systems change.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: There’s a lot of things we know now, and I laid them out in some detail.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Now again, when I say I laid them out, I’m not an office holder.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I’m running for office.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: It’s not like I’m still Vice President, or I wasn’t a United States Senator pushing this.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: So, I don’t want to say, “I, I, I.” But we did lay out exactly what needed to be done.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And take a look, we make up 4% of the world’s population.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: We have 20% of the world’s deaths.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: We’re in a situation where we have 210 plus thousand people dead.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And what’s he doing?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Nothing.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: He’s still not wearing masks, and so on.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: We’re getting some other questions on COVID.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Sure.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: The next one comes from Kelly Lee.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: She’s from Philadelphia.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Thank you.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Republican.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Voted for Donald Trump in 2016.

speaker: Audience Member 2
text: I did.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Undecided now.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Hey, Kelly.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: How are you?

speaker: Audience Member 2
text: Hi, Mr. Biden.

speaker: Audience Member 2
text: My question is about the coronavirus vaccine, or potential.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Yes.

speaker: Audience Member 2
text: Senator Harris stated that she absolutely would not take a vaccine from President Trump.

speaker: Audience Member 2
text: And of course, we all know it’s not President Trump that would create this vaccine.

speaker: Audience Member 2
text: It would be doctors and scientists that presumably we all trust.

speaker: Audience Member 2
text: So, my question for you is if a vaccine were approved between now and the end of the year, would you take it?

speaker: Audience Member 2
text: And if you were to become president, would you mandate that everyone has to take it?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Two things.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Number one, President Trump talks about things that just aren’t accurate, about everything from vaccines, we’re going to have one right away, is it going to happen, and so on.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: The point is that, if the scientists, if the body of scientists say that this is what is ready to be done, and it’s been tested, they’ve gone through the three phases.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Yes, I would take it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I’d encourage people to take it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: But President Trump says things like, everything from this crazy stuff he’s walking away from now, inject bleach in your arm, and that’s going to work.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I’m not being facetious, he’s actually said these things.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And now, Regeneron is the answer.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: That’s going to cure everything.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: There’s 500,000 doses, we have more than a few million people, you know?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And so, if you noticed, most of the companies who are developing these vaccines are working, they’re making real progress.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I meet with four leading scientists, at least twice a week.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: In the beginning, four times a week, giving us the detail on what kind of progress is being made.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And right now, they do the right thing.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: When they run into a serious problem, they halt the test.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: They don’t continue until they figure out what the problem was.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: They’re not there yet.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And the most scientists say, that it’s not likely to have a vaccine that would be available until the beginning of next year, into the spring of next year.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And in the meantime, what I worry about is the same thing with Regeneron, which is a useful antidote.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Not antidote, a useful tool.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: But what’s happening is there was no plan to figure out how to distribute it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: We have 500,000 vials of it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Well, we don’t have all the testing equipment.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: We don’t have all the ability to get it to the people who need it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And what we should be doing now, and allegedly it’s happening, but I’ve not seen it yet nor the docs that I’ve talked to seen it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: There should be a plan when we have the vaccine, how do we distribute it?

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: And once we get it, if it’s safe, if it’s effective, will you mandate its use?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: The answer is, depending on how clear… Vaccines, they say, have a very positive impact and that you’re going to affect positively 85% of the American public.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Or there’s others say, “This vaccine is really the key.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: This is the golden key.” It depends on the state of the nature of the vaccine when it comes out, and how it’s being distributed.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: But I would think that we should be talking about, depending on the continuation of the spread of the virus, we should be thinking about making it mandatory.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: How would you enforce that?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Well, you couldn’t, that’s the problem.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Just like you can’t enforce measles, you can’t come to school unless you have a measles shot.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: You know, you can’t.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: But you can’t say, everyone has to do this, just like you can’t mandate a mask.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: But you can say, you can go to every governor and get them all in a room, all 50 of them as president and say, ” Ask people to wear the mask.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Everybody knows.”

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: And if they don’t?

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Fines?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And if they don’t, no.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Not fine.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Then I go to every governor, I go to every mayor, I go to every councilmen, and I go to every local official, say, “Mandate the mask.” Say, “This is what you have to do when you’re out.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Make sure you encourage it being done.” Look, George, you and I know, and I think you do too as well, the words of a president matter.

speaker: Audience Member 2
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: No matter whether they’re good, bad, or indifferent, they matter.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And when a president doesn’t wear a mask or makes fun of folks like me, when I was wearing a mask for a long time, then people say, “Well, it mustn’t be that important.” But when a president says, “I think this is very important.” For example, I walked in here with this mask, but I have one of the N95 masks underneath it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I left it in my dressing room.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Not the dresser, the room I was in before I got here.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And so, I think it matters what we say.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And we’re now learning that children are getting the virus, not with as serious consequences, but there’s been no studies done yet on vaccines for children.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: So, there’s a long way to go, but we can make progress in the meantime and save lives.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And the last point I’ll make, if you listen to the head of the CDC, he stood up and he said, “You know, while we’re waiting for a vaccine.” He held up a mask.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: “You wear this mask, you’ll save more lives between now and the end of the year than if we had a vaccine.” It’s estimated by every major study done from the University of Washington to Columbia, that if in fact we wore masks, we could save, between now and the end of the year, a hundred thousand lives.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: And avoid lock downs?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And avoid lockdown, yes.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: You don’t have to lock down if you’re wearing the mask.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Let’s get a question on the economy.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Anthony Archer-

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Thank you, I hope I answered your question.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: … from Canonsburg, Pennsylvania, it’s a suburb of Pittsburgh.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Republican.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I know it.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Voted for President Trump.

speaker: Audience Member 3
text: Thank you, George.

speaker: Audience Member 3
text: Thank you, Mr. Vice President.

speaker: Audience Member 3
text: You stated that anyone making less than $400,000 will not see one single penny of their taxes raised.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: That’s right.

speaker: Audience Member 3
text: But also, state that you are going to eliminate the Trump tax cuts.

speaker: Audience Member 3
text: The Trump tax cuts reduces taxes for the majority of workers.

speaker: Audience Member 3
text: I would argue, not enough.

speaker: Audience Member 3
text: What is your plan for either extending the tax cuts for the middle-class, or creating a new plan that further reduces those taxes?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: I carry this card with me.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: When I said the Trump tax cuts, about 1.3 trillion of the $2 trillion in his tax cuts went to the top one 10th of 1%.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: That’s what I’m talking about eliminating, not all the tax cuts that are out there.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And by the way, if you take a look, we reduced the corporate tax rate from 35%.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: and Democrats, Republicans who were in office thought it should come down to 28%.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: He reduced it to 21%.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: You have 91 out of the Fortune 500 companies not paying a single solitary penny.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: If you raise the corporate tax back to 28%, which is a fair tax, you’d raise one trillion, three hundred billion dollars by that one act.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: If you made sure that people making over 400 grand paid what they did in the Bush administration, 39.6%, you would raise another, it goes up to let me get you the exact number here, about another 200, excuse me.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: $92 billion.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: So, you could raise a lot of money to be able to invest in things that can make your life easier.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Make you change your standard of living by making sure you have affordable health care, by making sure you’re in a situation where you’re able to send your kid to school.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: If you have student debt, you can deal with it.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Making sure that your home, you can pay your mortgage.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: You got 20 million people, right now.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Mr. Vice President, let me press you on that though.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Sure.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: You’re going to raise the corporate tax, you’re going to raise taxes on the wealthy.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Is it wise to do even that when the economy is as weak as it is right now?

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Absolutely.

speaker: George Stephanopoulos
text: Another 900,000 people have filed for unemployment.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: That’s a great question.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Moody’s did analysis of my detailed analysis of my tax plan and my economic plan.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: They said, I will, in four years, Moody’s Wall Street, said I will create 18.6 million new jobs, good paying jobs, number one.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Number two, the GDP will grow by a trillion dollars more than would under Trump, and 7 million more jobs than under Trump.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And the reason is, when you allow people to get back in the game and have a job, everything moves.

text: Everything moves.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Right now, you got the opposite.

text: You had, last year during this pandemic, you had the wealthiest billionaires in the world, in the nation, they made another $700 billion.

text: $700 billion.

text: He talks about a V-shape recovery.

text: If you’re on the top, you’re going to do very well.

text: And if you’re in the bottom, or you’re in the middle or the bottom, your income is coming down.

text: You’re not getting a raise.

text: I shouldn’t, I don’t know what you do.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: You may get a raise.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Hope you’re a billionaire.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: But all kidding aside, it’s about growing the economy.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And George, the way out, the reason why I’m so optimistic about economic recovery, more than I’ve ever been, is we have these four crises happening all at once.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: And one helps the other.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: For example, we’re going to invest a great deal of that money into infrastructure, and to a green infrastructure.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: We’re going to put 500,000 charging stations on new highways we’re building, and all highways we’re building.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: We’re going to own the electric market.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: You know as well as I do from your days, you know, in the old days, where the president spends about $600 billion a year on government contracts.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: Everything from making sure they have aircraft carriers, to automobile fleets in the United States.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: If you make, and it’s not in violation of any international trade agreement, made in America.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: If you actually insist that whatever that product is, made in America, including the material that goes into the product.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: It is estimated we’re going to create somewhere between another four and six million jobs just by doing that.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: But what’s happening now under his trade policy, a lot of this is going overseas.

text: You get a benefit from going overseas, if you have much of it being made overseas.

text: So, if you send it overseas, you get a 10% tax increase on a product.

speaker: Joe Biden
text: If you make it in America and you bring it back, you get a 10% growth.

text: If you bring back a company, and you’re going to open up an old facility, you get a 10% tax credit for all you invested.

text: That actually works, George.

text: We are a democracy.

text: Some of my Republican friends and some of my Democratic friends, even occasionally say, “Well, if you can’t get the votes by executive order, you’re going to do something.

text: Things you can’t do by executive order, unless you’re a dictator.” We’re democracy, we need consensus.

text: Then the next question is, am I worthy of your vote?

text: One is, in addition to dealing with a criminal justice system to make it fairer and make it more decent, we have to be able to put Black Americans in a position to be able to gain wealth, generate wealth.
